messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bears
messages.msgSnippet: ... If you want snow and cold, you might get a week or two of them there . . . most years. Tia
messages.messageBody:
> There's also one in Redmond, Washington State.

If you want snow and cold, you might get a week or two of them there . . .
most years.
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bears
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, DH has located a job in Minneapolis. Whats that like? We could live about half an hour to the north. Is is cold n snowy inna winter with long
messages.messageBody:
On 28 Oct 02, at 14:57, Kelli Traaseth wrote:

>
> Oh, Pleeaasse, there are certain areas of Minnesota and Iowa that
> have lots of Mosquitos, personally where I am it isn't too bad and we
> have woods right behind us. By rivers and right on lakes of course
> it is worse, but the pluses of living here totally outweight the
> bugs!! Especially when I get to listen to our real state bird the
> loon! There are tons of differences between Iowa and Minnesota, I hope
> you know.
>
> Can't tell I like Minnesota better, can you?
> And gee, Brenda, should I shut up about Minnesota? Too bad,
> not gonna happen...<g> Kelli
>
Well, DH has located a job in Minneapolis. Whats that like?
We could live about half an hour to the north. Is is cold n snowy
inna winter with long winters?
I'm sure someone told me the summers were hot n sticky :-(

There's also one in Redmond, Washington State.

Shyrley


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bears
messages.msgSnippet: ... Didn t the news get as far as Minnesota? We had the county spraying the area claiming the spray was harmless but to stay in doors anyway. They really got
messages.messageBody:
On 29 Oct 02, at 11:26, Kelli Traaseth wrote:

>
> Malaria, here? OK , hopefully I'm missing the humor in your voices.
> Kelli
> Shyrley <shyrley.williams@...> wrote:On 29 Oct 02, at 20:25,
> Alan & Brenda Leonard wrote:
>
Didn't the news get as far as Minnesota? We had the county
spraying the area claiming the spray was harmless but to stay in
doors anyway. They really got their knickers in a twist. They'll e
spraying again this week and Fairfax county are filling all the ponds
with larvacide.
This year Virginia, next year everywhere I imagine. Same as West
Nile which we've got here in spades too.

Shyrley


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bears
messages.msgSnippet: Malaria, here?    OK , hopefully I m missing the humor in your voices. Kelli ... Malaria doesn t bother me. We had two confirmed cases in Virginia here in
messages.messageBody:
Malaria, here? OK , hopefully I'm missing the humor in your voices.
Kelli
Shyrley <shyrley.williams@...> wrote:On 29 Oct 02, at 20:25, Alan & Brenda Leonard wrote:

> 10/29/02 00:02:
>
> > Brenda,
> > Where are you living now?
> > Kelli
>
> Germany. Gosh, I thought by now everybody knew that and was TOTALLY
> sick of hearing me complain about it....... We're here with the army,
> and I wanna go home. I'm moving this week, but only 30 km down the
> road.
>
> I know the state bird is the loon, really. I honeymooned in
> Minnesota, in the Boundry Waters Canoe Area. I really like it there.
> But I do also distinctly remember your mosquitos are a whoooooole lot
> bigger than the ones I grew up with in Iowa!
>
> But I supposed it's possible Shyrley might be willing to put up with
> them for some of the other good stuff Minnesota has...maybe....if she
> gets her vaccinations for malaria and all that! hee hee hee
>
> brenda
>
Malaria doesn't bother me. We had two confirmed cases in
Virginia here in Loudoun county a month a go. The county sprayed
and has found numbers of malaria carrying mozzies as have the
surrounding counties.
Minn is sounding good to me. I bin looking at web sitesand its so
pretty up there. DH could tele-work from VA and fly here once a
month or so.
Now I'd like a 6 bed house with 20 acres :-)

Do you get homesick Brenda? How long you been in Germany?
How much longer to go?

Shyrley




"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bears
messages.msgSnippet: ... Germany.  Gosh, I thought by now everybody knew that and was TOTALLY sick of hearing me complain about it.......  We re here with the army, and I wanna go
messages.messageBody:
10/29/02 00:02:

> Brenda,
> Where are you living now?
> Kelli

Germany. Gosh, I thought by now everybody knew that and was TOTALLY sick of
hearing me complain about it....... We're here with the army, and I wanna
go home. I'm moving this week, but only 30 km down the road.

I know the state bird is the loon, really. I honeymooned in Minnesota, in
the Boundry Waters Canoe Area. I really like it there. But I do also
distinctly remember your mosquitos are a whoooooole lot bigger than the ones
I grew up with in Iowa!

But I supposed it's possible Shyrley might be willing to put up with them
for some of the other good stuff Minnesota has...maybe....if she gets her
vaccinations for malaria and all that! hee hee hee

brenda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bears
messages.msgSnippet: Yeah,  I knew you were out of this country but I couldn t remember where,  I think sometimes I d rather be where you are!  I m sure that has been discussed
messages.messageBody:
Yeah, I knew you were out of this country but I couldn't remember where, I think sometimes I'd rather be where you are! I'm sure that has been discussed before.

Take Care,
Kelli
Alan & Brenda Leonard <abtleo@...> wrote:10/29/02 00:02:

> Brenda,
> Where are you living now?
> Kelli

Germany. Gosh, I thought by now everybody knew that and was TOTALLY sick of
hearing me complain about it....... We're here with the army, and I wanna
go home. I'm moving this week, but only 30 km down the road.

I know the state bird is the loon, really. I honeymooned in Minnesota, in
the Boundry Waters Canoe Area. I really like it there. But I do also
distinctly remember your mosquitos are a whoooooole lot bigger than the ones
I grew up with in Iowa!

But I supposed it's possible Shyrley might be willing to put up with them
for some of the other good stuff Minnesota has...maybe....if she gets her
vaccinations for malaria and all that! hee hee hee

brenda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bears
messages.msgSnippet: ... I just want to get away from Virginia summers. I loathe humidity and I get uncomfortable when the temp rises above about 75F. And I neeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeed
messages.messageBody:
On 28 Oct 02, at 21:48, Alan & Brenda Leonard wrote:

> 10/27/02 17:48:
>
> > Hey Shyrley!
> > We have lots of bears up here!<g>
> > Yeah, Minnesota, again!
> > Kelli
>
> Ok, Kelli,
>
> I gotta get in on this one....
>
> Please, tell them about your state bird up there.....you know, the
> mosquito!!!!
>
> (Shyrley, you do NOT want to move up there!)
>
> <beg>
>
> brenda, originally from Iowa
>
I just want to get away from Virginia summers. I loathe humidity
and I get uncomfortable when the temp rises above about 75F. And
I neeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeed snow.
Getting away from the traffic hell here and the Stepford mentality
would be a secondary benefit.
DH announced we need to spend another two years in the States
before I can go home. It seems such a long time :-(

Shyrley


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bears
messages.msgSnippet: Brenda, Where are you living now? Kelli ... Ok, Kelli, I gotta get in on this one.... Please, tell them about your state bird up there.....you know, the
messages.messageBody:
Brenda,
Where are you living now?
Kelli
Alan & Brenda Leonard <abtleo@...> wrote:10/27/02 17:48:

> Hey Shyrley!
> We have lots of bears up here!<g>
> Yeah, Minnesota, again!
> Kelli

Ok, Kelli,

I gotta get in on this one....

Please, tell them about your state bird up there.....you know, the
mosquito!!!!

(Shyrley, you do NOT want to move up there!)

<beg>

brenda, originally from Iowa

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bears
messages.msgSnippet: Oh,  Pleeaasse,  there are certain areas of Minnesota and Iowa that have lots of Mosquitos,  personally where I am it isn t too bad and we have woods right
messages.messageBody:
Oh, Pleeaasse, there are certain areas of Minnesota and Iowa that have lots of Mosquitos, personally where I am it isn't too bad and we have woods right behind us.
By rivers and right on lakes of course it is worse, but the pluses of living here totally outweight the bugs!! Especially when I get to listen to our real state bird the loon!
There are tons of differences between Iowa and Minnesota, I hope you know.

Can't tell I like Minnesota better, can you?
And gee, Brenda, should I shut up about Minnesota? Too bad, not gonna happen...<g>
Kelli
Alan & Brenda Leonard <abtleo@...> wrote:10/27/02 17:48:

> Hey Shyrley!
> We have lots of bears up here!<g>
> Yeah, Minnesota, again!
> Kelli

Ok, Kelli,

I gotta get in on this one....

Please, tell them about your state bird up there.....you know, the
mosquito!!!!

(Shyrley, you do NOT want to move up there!)

<beg>

brenda, originally from Iowa
